fields.Notes:
My goal making this video was:
- To show where my country is located.
- What\'s the main language spoked there.
- What languages we have in Angola and how they influence the Angolan Portuguese.

Para terem uma ideia de onde fica Angola. No sul do continente africano. L√° em baixo no mapa temos a √Åfrica do
sul, por cima da √Åfrica do Sul, Nam√≠bia e Botswana e depois Angola, que est√° ao lado da Z√¢mbia.

Apesar de a l√≠ngua oficial de Angola ser o Portugu√™s. H√° muitas outras l√≠nguas que s√£o de Angola, faladas
por v√°rios grupos √©tnicos. Umbundu, Kimbundu, Kikongo, Chocu√©, Kwanhama e o Ganguela.

O portugu√™s de Angola recebe muita influ√™ncia lingu√≠stica dessas l√≠nguas. Muitas palavras e express√µes
usadas no dia-a-dia s√£o derivadas dessas l√≠nguas nacionais. Por exemplo, chamamos os mais velhos, ou pessoas
de mais idade, de kota. Kota vem da palavra \"Dikota\" em kimbundu, chamamos de ca√ßula, ao filho mais novo
e essa express√£o vem do termo \"Kasule\" em kimbundu que significa filho mais novo.

O portugu√™s de Angola √© uma l√≠ngua muito interessante e foi bom partilhar essas informa√ß√µes convosco.

Um forte abra√ßo e... tenham um √≥ptimo dia.
fields.Translation:
Hello! Good morning, good afternoon, good evening. How are you? I am very well, thanks.
My name is H√©lder St√©fane and I\'m speaking Portuguese, which is the most used language in Angola. Angola is in Africa, and around Angola we have the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Zambia, Namibia and we have the Atlantic Ocean.

To get an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãwhere Angola is: in the south of the African continent, down the map we have
South Africa, over South Africa_> Namibia and Botswana and then Angola, which is next to Zambia.

Although the official language of Angola is Portuguese, there are many other languages ‚Äã‚Äãspoken in Angola by various ethnic groups: Umbundu, Kimbundu, Kikongo, Chocu√©, Kwanhama and the Ganguela.

Portuguese from Angola receives a lot of linguistic influence from these languages. Many words and expressions
in everyday life are derived from these national languages. For example, we call elders, or older people, of kota. Kota comes from the word \"Dikota\" in Kimbundu.  We call \"ca√ßula\", the youngest son,
and this expression comes from the term \"Kasule\" in Kimbundu which means younger son.

Angola\'s Portuguese is a very interesting language and it was good to share this information with you.

A big hug and ... have a great day.
